page.title: 04WINDPUMPS IN S.E NORFOLK
page.content: Wind mills or more correctly, pumps are a familiar sight in East Norfolk. Few retain their sails and many are now in a dangerous state of disrepair. They bear witness to the skill of 16th Century Dutch refugees,who were responsible for the present landscape through drainage schemes.This Dutch influence is occasionally seen in the gable-ends of local houses.Berney Arms mill at the confluence of the rivers Yare and Waveney,is well preserved and demonstrates the paddle wheel system used.
